You Vlad bro?

Sadly I dodge whenever I  see a champion being played like {{champion:8}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:20}}. Not going to lie I think {{champion:266}} might be slightly more viable than vlad right now. In all honesty I thought he was fine Pre-rework and then Riot broke him and had to nerf him to this state.

Don't underestimate any of those in the hands of experts.

Except maybe Nunu. Idk why anyone is playing Nunu when Ivern exists.

> [{quoted}](name=Tides of Blood,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3szZrkGm,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2017-01-13T19:29:41.474+0000)
>
> Don't underestimate any of those in the hands of experts.
> 
> Except maybe Nunu. Idk why anyone is playing Nunu when Ivern exists.

Yah man I have been hyper carried by the dumbest most unmeta shit but sadly, 9 times out of 10 vlad/taliyah etc feed their nutz off. I'm sure you could carry me as vlad though :D

To be fair almost every Vayne and Yauso and Lee Sin feed too. At least with the less played, less strong champions, the people playing them know they're weak so you're more likely to get a "main" instead of a "hurr durr freelo" player

https://31.media.tumblr.com/f391d51658870147a1baf0492c5e5e60/tumblr_inline_n995l22JBZ1renx5h.gif

Awwww.
https://media.giphy.com/media/FlHuACrCGXkc0/giphy.gif

Nunu does much better as a tank, has poorer cc in general but better cc on entire teams with his ult, he can afford to be out of jungle a lot more than Ivern (no need to collect groves, and his q stacks fall of slowly). Also, while it's not as big a secure as cho'gath ult, q+smite is really good for objectives.

That said, I agree most of Nunu's unique strengths are shared in better form by Ivern.
Taliyah's actually pretty good in the right hands, but I do agree she feels a little on the weaker side.
His most common build, imo.
As someone who was 820 k mastery points on him it Feelsvladman
I'm actually happy yet sad to say that I said this as I clicked it

Meddler talked about buffs in 7.2 I'm so excited
I almost forgot she's a champion.

I used to be relatively decent on pre-work vlad but I just can't get the hang of using his e and empowered Q. Its like whenever I get my Q empowered the enemy just stays way back because they know that its coming with how telegraphed it is and the short range. Then with his E, again is pretty straight forward that he's gonna use it. You see it charging, you see him moving towards you since it can be body blocked you just stay on the otherside of your minions.  

ON the other hand, I've seen people do pretty good with him. Just not my play style I guess.
It's one of those things you learn. There's not much room for subtly with Vlad, just get into a position where they're forced to take your damage and make them suffer for getting too close to you.

Orange you vlad that he doesn't get banned?

I'll show myself out now.
I thought it was his playerbase.
